alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:18AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, northern Buchanan, northwestern McDowell, south central Cabell, Mingo, southwestern Lincoln, western Logan and Wayne Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 317 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Hode, or 14 miles east of Inez, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Wayne, Delbarton, Gilbert Creek, Holden, South Williamson, East Lynn Lake, Red Jacket, Chattaroy, Aflex, Kiahsville, Hinch, Dunlow, Oppy, Harts, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Matewan, Gilbert, Kermit and Iaeger. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Cabell; Lincoln; Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Wayne
